text: Why does the Python Tutorial say that list comprehensions are more flexible than map()?
In the Python Tutorial, it says:
I don't see how comprehensions are "more flexible".
It seems to me to be only a difference in syntax.

code:
def my_round(i):
    return str(round(355/113.0, i))

a = map(my_round, range(1, 6))

text: I don't see how map() lacks flexibility here.
